intro: Euphorbia ankazobensis, commonly known as the Ankazobé euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces a unique cyathium, a specialized inflorescence typical of the Euphorbia genus. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to conserve water. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
